column5: This is my in boat fish finder.Lately I have noticed the depth readings are all over the place most times.Sometimes 6',15' whatever(accurate),but most times reading #'s like 542,430ft etc,no where near accurate.Gradually been getting worse.Do you ever have to clean and scrub your transducer.?.Just washed mine with a good cleaning soap and rinsed.Looked a bit dirty but nothing serious. Would this little maintenance make a difference?.In 6 years I have never touched it.Thanks for any help guys.  Dave.

I've got a pair of Lowrance X510C units and they've both done the same thing a couple times, but I just shut the unit down and re-started it and everything was good again.  My transducer is a shoot thru hull type but I have no idea if that could be causing the same issue on mine.

I've got a pair of Lowrance X510C units and they've both done the same thing a couple times, but I just shut the unit down and re-started it and everything was good again.  My transducer is a shoot thru hull type but I have no idea if that could be causing the same issue on mine. Mine lew is out the transom and mounted on the lower part 1/2 in water stream.As it should from what I have read and did work well for a while.Wonder if there is a hard reboot for this unit?
Your transducer is fried. Only fix is buy a new one.
Your transducer is fried. Only fix is buy a new one. Think it's worth it for that finder Glen?
Ebay the finder you have. Look at 718 humminbird.
My lowrance also does this once in a while---I think it loses bottom  Like Lew--I shut it off/on works ok
I can see what your first purchase is going to be at the Cabelas opening. LOL
I can see what your first purchase is going to be at the Cabelas opening. LOL Quit spending any little money I have will you lol.I do see your point though !!

My lowrance also does this once in a while---I think it loses bottom  Like Lew--I shut it off/on works ok I have done that,but most times won't work.I gave the transponder a good hand polish.Nice and clean now.Looking for a simple fix first.Intermittant as heck at times.Thanks guys.
Wack it with a hammer   That's a sure sign however that the transducer is on it's way out.  I'd get a replacement on order.
Wack it with a hammer   That's a sure sign however that the transducer is on it's way out.  I'd get a replacement on order. You think it is worth it Bill?,don't want to spend a lot for sure .
If this is the only fish finder on your rig, yeah I'd definitely say it's worth it..   6 years out of a transducer isn't bad

If this is the only fish finder on your rig, yeah I'd definitely say it's worth it..   6 years out of a transducer isn't bad Thanks,I never new they wore so fast?.Thought they would last longer than that.I guess 6 years in this technical world is pretty fair come to think of it.
how much is a new transducer? I've seen crappy tire clearing out humming bird units at very good prices lately
